markdown.headingText: Hi, I'm Nive!
markdown.markdown: ::: {#nivedhitha-header} I'm a Software Engineer with a [Masterâ€™s in Computational Data Science](https://mcds.cs.cmu.edu/learn-us) from Carnegie Mellon University. I specialize in building scalable ML systems at the intersection of **Real-time Data Infrastructure**, **Intelligent Agents**, and **High-performance Computing Backend Platforms**. My experience spans end-to-end ML workflows, edge inference optimization, and LLM-based agents with structured reasoning. I've contributed to distributed systems, observability pipelines, and database-driven ETL platforms using technologies like `Kafka`, `Kubernetes`, `PyTorch`, `TensorFlow Lite`, `PostgreSQL`, `AWS`, and `GCP`. At Citi and Fidelity, I modernized infrastructure, boosted backend throughput, and automated secure, large-scale ETL pipelines powering critical analytics. I'm currently seeking roles in **Software Engineering**, **ML Platforms**, or **Data Infrastructure**, where I can build reliable and efficient systems at scale. Latest Resume ::: ### ðŸš€ Actively Seeking Roles - **Target Roles:** Software Engineer,Machine Learning Engineer,Data Engineer,Data Scientist,Applied Scientist - **Core Focus Areas:** `Real-Time ETL & Observability`, `Distributed ML Systems`, `High-Performance Computing`, `Backend Infrastructure`, `LLM Agents & Tooling`, `On-Device AI (Wearables)`, `Cloud-Native Pipelines (AWS, GCP, Kubernetes)` ### âœ¨ Highlights - **15 May 2025**: My summer research was ACCEPTED at the Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics 2025. - **11 May 2025**: Graduated from the School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University, completing my Master's in Computational Data Science with dual concentrations in Analytics and Human-AI Interaction. - **13 April 2025**: Winner of the AI Agents Weekend 2025 hackathon sponsored by Google & DeepMind for the Most Effective Project. - **13 March 2025**: Filed Indian Patent for BrailleVoice (UG Capstone Project), an accessible voice-assisted Braille reader for the visually impaired.
